p: Comparing 2015 with 2010, most states and DC either began reporting viral suppression data or had improvements in the proportion of PWH virally suppressed ( Fig 2). Most states did not experience changes to a lower quartile of estimated HIV incidence rate, although one populous state (New York) did, as did two others (Minnesota and Oregon). Overall mean (±standard deviation) viral suppression among PWH steadily increased from 32.3% ± 6.6% in 2010 to 49.4% ± 7.1% in 2015 ( Table 1) for the 30 jurisdictions.
